byline.original: By THOM SHANKER and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: News analysis; NATO's successful intervention in Libya gives senior Obama administration officials opportunity to trumpet new American way of war, with its heavy emphasis on drone technology; despite its success, intervention has had several significant flaws that highlight why future offensives could be far more difficult.
snippet: The United States remains the backbone of any NATO offensive, even while “leading from behind.”

lead_paragraph: The United States remains the backbone of any NATO offensive, even while “leading from behind.”

headline.main: Seeing Limits to ‘New’ Kind of War in Libya
headline.seo: NATO War in Libya Shows U.S. Was Vital to Toppling Qaddafi
